channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The Fed holds interest rates steady despite pressure from President Trump, Republicans in Texas release a proposal for a new congressional map, Trump's special envoy to the Middle East makes his first trip to Israel since May.

item.title: Republicans in Texas release a proposal for a new congressional map
item.description: Republicans in Texas have released a proposal for a new state congressional map. President Trump has said he wants a map that helps his party win five more House seats in next year's midterms.

item.title: Kamala Harris' political future
item.description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris has announced she won't run for California governor in 2026, but she has left open the possibility of a future political run.

item.title: Senator Alex Padilla on redistricting efforts by Republicans
item.description: A Martinez talks with Sen. Alex Padilla of California about Democrats' plans to push back against Republicans' redistricting efforts, with control of the House at stake in the midterm elections.

item.title: What is 'Google Zero' and what could it mean for the web?
item.description: Online publishing depends on web traffic. With the rise of Google AI Overview and other AI-powered tools, fewer and fewer are clicking links. This is all leading to what some are calling Google Zero, when search engines no longer send any traffic to websites. Such a scenario would make many parts of the web collapse entirely.

item.title: Some parents struggle to keep up with the rising cost of school supplies
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with school social worker Kia Baker and educator Melvin Bond about how parents in Baltimore struggle to keep up with the rising cost of school supplies.

item.title: The NTSB holds hearings on the DCA midair collision
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board began an investigative hearing with new details into last January's midair collision between an Army helicopter and an American Airlines regional jet.

item.title: The Academy of American Poets announces new fellows
item.description: The Academy of American Poets announces its list of 23 new poet laureate fellows, awarding them a total of $1.1 million dollars across the United States.

item.title: Trump likes to give deadlines — but what does 'time' even mean?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Bhaskar Pant, an expert in intercultural communication and Executive Director of MIT Professional Education, about how different cultures perceive time.

item.title: England's Birmingham bids farewell to Ozzy Osbourne, its homegrown heavy metal hero
item.description: Fans and relatives of the late Ozzy Osbourne converged to pay their final respects to metal star in his home city.
